entries.speaker: Narrator
entries.text: The world inverts. Reality bends. The corrupted spirit of Ranima manifests in a surreal, twisted version of the household.

entries.speaker: Ranima Corrupted
entries.text: You dare disturb what I have buried? She is MINE! This house is MINE!

entries.speaker: Dom
entries.text: No! The truth will not stay buried. The earth itself rejects your cruelty.

entries.speaker: Narrator
entries.text: Navigate the twisted landscape. Avoid Ranima's corrupted attacks. Use the spirit orbs to weaken her hold.

entries.speaker: Narrator
entries.text: The spirit orbs collected from Tejimola's memories burn with truth. Use them [F] to slow the corruption.

entries.speaker: Tejimola Spirit
entries.text: I am not afraid anymore. Not of you. Not of the darkness.
entries.textAssamese: মই আৰু ভয় নকৰোঁ। তোমাক নহয়। আন্ধাৰক নহয়।

entries.speaker: Narrator
entries.text: In desperation, the corruption conjures the spiked barrel - the very instrument of cruelty. But the jungle itself rises against it.

entries.speaker: Narrator
entries.text: Dodge the barrels! The vines and roots of the nahor tree will turn them back against the corruption.

entries.speaker: Narrator
entries.text: The corruption fades. The twisted world unravels. What remains is silence... and the soft rustle of leaves.

entries.speaker: Narrator
entries.text: The corrupted form dissolves. The injustice is answered. Not with vengeance, but with remembrance.

entries.speaker: Narrator
entries.text: A new day dawns. The sunrise paints the sky in gold and rose.

entries.speaker: Narrator
entries.text: Dom stands before the nahor tree. It is in full bloom - white petals drifting on a warm breeze.

entries.speaker: Tejimola Spirit
entries.text: Thank you... for remembering me. For giving me voice.
entries.textAssamese: ধন্যবাদ... মোক মনত ৰখাৰ বাবে। মোক মাত দিয়াৰ বাবে।

entries.speaker: Dom
entries.text: Your story will be told. Through the drum, through the flowers, through every bloom of the nahor tree.

entries.speaker: Narrator
entries.text: [Warm breeze blows. Tears fall gently. The nahor tree blooms with a radiance that feels like love itself.]

entries.speaker: Tejimola Spirit
entries.text: I am free now. And the flowers... they will always bloom.
entries.textAssamese: মই এতিয়া মুক্ত। আৰু ফুলবোৰ... সেইবোৰ সদায় ফুলি থাকিব।

entries.speaker: Narrator
entries.text: [The spirit gently dissolves into the petals of the nahor tree. Dom walks away, carrying her story in his drum.]

entries.speaker: Narrator
entries.text:
TEJIMOLA: THE BLOSSOM FROM CLAY

Based on the Assamese folktale.
Remembering the stories that must never be forgotten.
